value:
Reptor, Bloom, Hilda... I can't forgive
the things they've done, but the
people of Friege are innocent.

House Friege took my sister and
mother... I've hated them ever since.
I intend to destroy them myself.

A commander must realize that there
is a time for perseverance and a time
for rest if they want to stay sharp.

I suppose that someday, someone
from Bloom's bloodline may hate me
as much as I hate them now.

I keep this pendant to remind me of
my mother.

Here, this is for you. It's from
$Nf.

Bloom! Hilda! I will make you pay for
the things you've done!

Would you mind... Oh, just stay out of
my way!
Phew... I pushed it a little too hard.

I must be strong if I'm going to
avenge my mother's death and
protect my sister.

I am Arthur. My mother was a mage.
Though my magic might not be as
strong, I will do my best to help you.

My mother was a mage in the
liberation army. After one terrible
battle, she fled with me to Silesse.$k$pThat's where we were when she and
my newborn baby sister were taken.
All I was left with was this pendant.$k$pI was surprised to learn that King
Bloom of Ulster took my mother and
sister, and a little relieved too.$k$pMy mother was of his House Friege,
after all. But then I heard that she
passed away. Damn that witch Hilda!$k$pAh, I'm...OK. I'm calm. I just get so
angry when I think of it. Thank you
for listening.
はっ
てやっ
うっ…
強いな…
I've got something to show you!
As if I would lose!
I won't allow it!
She will be safe!
Did I... really lose...
Ahaha
I'm Arthur. I traveled here from Silesse.
Ah! Never surprise me like that. I might have hurt you.
My mother and sister were taken from me when I was very young. I had to build a life on my own.
Is Fee here too? She's a good person, and her energy is infectious.
My mother was a mage too. She served in the liberation army.
Hilda, the woman that drove my mother to her death... I will destroy her with my own hands.
Working with you is always interesting. It would please me to stay and help you for a while.
Need me again?
I suppose.
Leave it to me.
